items.title: From legal settlements to business ventures, mega corporations are making deals with President Donald Trump and the Trump family
items.description: Companies have reportedly doled out $80 million to the Trump family and his presidential library, according to the Wall Street Journal.

items.title: Are ‘healthy’ sodas actually good for you? What benefits Olipop and Poppi actually have
items.description: What to know about the trendy sodas that tout gut-health benefits.

items.title: Gen Z’s expensive drug habit: More want brand-name meds that are 79% more expensive
items.description: Most Americans would prefer brand-name drugs—but end up buying generic versions because of the cost, new consumer research suggests.

items.title: Dismissed nuclear bomb specialists recalled by Energy Department
items.description: Between 300 and 400 workers at the National Nuclear Safety Administration were terminated.

items.title: Buffett sold more BofA stock while keeping Apple stake intact
items.description: Berkshire Hathaway cut its stake in the bank to 8.9% in the fourth quarter after selling 117.5 million shares.
